title: TheSchreibmaschine
author: TheSchreibmaschine
content: I remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: TheSchreibmaschine on June 28, 2022, 05:09:29 PMI remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?I remember one btcclicks or something like that. although I also know that I have seen accusations somewhere that they did not pay the promised earnings.there are not many of them that have survived from 2012 until now. freebitco.in is one of the oldest services of its kind, which still works.If you trying to find some similar services but functional, you should probably look at the micro earning section in this forum

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: If you're trying gto find funds you've misplaced, I remember bitvisitor used to pay to addresses (I used them back in 2015, you'd put in your address -> hit go and it'd take you to a website thst was being advertised, you had to stay on the page for half a minute to get paid but some of them were quite interesting to scroll through (considering most were crypto related and I was new at the time - this was back in 2015).

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: TheSchreibmaschine on June 28, 2022, 05:09:29 PMI remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?Your only search should be on the services that have been working since that year and are still working because it will be almost impossible for a service that stopped working to refund you, especially since you did a small task for like 5 bitcoins and now you ask them to pay about 100k.But if you're trying to get your money back, it's a near to impossible task

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: TheSchreibmaschine on June 28, 2022, 05:09:29 PMI remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?As said, if you want to recover funds from such services then you're dreaming.However, this Google search should return some such websites, you can paste it into your browser and give it a try, maybe some result from there would ring a bell:Code:https://www.google.com/search?q=earn+bitcoin+watch+ads&hl=en&tbs=cdr%3A1%2Ccd_min%3A1%2F1%2F2010%2Ccd_max%3A12%2F31%2F2012&tbm=

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Any chance you initiated a withdrawal and forgot about them? or the payout was automated or something?If you were registered, one or two emails from them could be in your email account, try to search related keywords or just look at all the "verify your account" emails during the target time period.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: You're probably talking about one of dozens of paid-to-surf or paid-to-click (PTC) sites. Think KickassTraffic was one of the longest around, they actually only added Bitcoin as a payment method later on, they were around from the mid-2000s paying in PayPal or other. Google PTC Bitcoin and filter search to those years, see if you get any hits.I actually did that in the late 90s, back when they actually paid dollars and not cents, and sent you cheques to anywhere in the world. Yeah, I'm old.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Did you mean freebitcoins faucet by @Gavin Andresen ANN link ---> Get 5 free bitcoins from freebitcoins.appspot.comCheck design ---> https://web.archive.org/web/20100703032414/http://freebitcoins.appspot.com/you can use this forum as a time machine, I found another faucet --->  [ANN] New bitcoin faucet! All bunnies win @ bunnyrun.us Just search using the word "faucet" for old topics.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on June 28, 2022, 05:18:21 PMI remember one btcclicks or something like that. although I also know that I have seen accusations somewhere that they did not pay the promised earnings.That's one of the sites I used in 2015 when I first got to know bitcoin, I don't know about the accusations but it seems you are right. I recently checked my account and it looks like they have reset my earnings to 0 while the statistics show I have clicked on ads a few times. No more expectations from this site, I hope this is not what the OP meant

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: TheSchreibmaschine on June 28, 2022, 05:09:29 PMI remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?Did you have to sign up and register on that website?There could be something like this is early days of Bitcoin, but watch out for any new website that is claiming to do something similar.I did a quick youtube video search with that phrase and I saw a bunch of fake claims, click baits and promotional scams.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Lol, I had used such as the beginning of the crypto journey. There were revshare sites & PTC sites. I can remember only paid verts that are still active and running ads. But not sure if they are still paying users. Lately, I think it's waste of time looking for paid to clicks. I think it won't even cover your Internet bills lately.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: The PTC that I know that I used before is Neobux and Clicksense but only Neobux that I heard added BTC withdrawal. I tried a little deep search and found BTCclicks it seems it is the only oldest PTC before that pays in Bitcoin.Or if you talking about watching a website for a few minutes then bitvisitor.com and earnfreebitcoins.com are what I found when searching them through archive.orgAnd it seems those domains are still alive.What do you plan why you are looking for those old sites? Are you planning to try to log in again and expect for remaining funds to withdraw?

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Paid To Click (PTC) as far as I remember there are some who pay with btc but forget the names just remember btcclicks tried to search on google and the website is still there just don't know if they are still paying, I think the period of PTC is over because not many new PTCs have sprung up even some of those who are still surviving turn into survey panels like clixsense.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: 2010-2012 is very early year of Bitcoin, I'm not really sure that tthere was Bitcoin PTC back then, or at least it wasn't marked in the history. Btcclicks name mentioned in this thread few times, but I'm not really sure that's this website that you're looking for, it obly started in 2013.Quote from: BitMaxz on June 29, 2022, 11:49:31 PMThe PTC that I know that I used before is Neobux and Clicksense but only Neobux that I heard added BTC withdrawal. Did Neobux ever had Bitcoin as payment option? I had account there from 2015 and I can't remember them having Bitcoin payment option. Maybe it was a bit earlier and they later removed it.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: The Cryptovator on June 29, 2022, 07:25:10 PMLately, I think it's waste of time looking for paid to clicks. I think it won't even cover your Internet bills lately. It will surely not cover the internet bills, it's an obvious waste of time. Maybe it could cover internet bills if one does the tasks with multiple accounts. Does it worth the time, even at that  multiple devices consumes more data. Lolx...Those early faucets, were they actually paying in bitcoins? If yes, it means that many btc were lost in early stages of bitcoin because some of those rewards are never claimed but might be paid. How fast things changed, I wished I was in thus space earlier.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: TheSchreibmaschine on June 28, 2022, 05:09:29 PMI remember being registered on a platform, where you could watch ads and get Bitcoins in return. It was in 2010-2012. Does somebody remember a service like this existed or even know the name?To many service the same like this exist before and I almost forget all of them but there's one famous and thst is btcclicks. I don't know if this one exist so much better search their official site by googling it as well search more site since google has so large scoop and provably there are so many sites will pop up upon searching that key words.
